venue.name: Dirt Parking Area just Past Underpass of NH 101

item.description:
While heading on Interstate 93 N or 93 S in Manchester, NH take exit 7 to go onto NH-101 heading East.

On NH-101 East in Auburn, NH turn right at the end of the ramp for Exit 2 in Auburn, NH.

If on NH 101 West turn left at the end of the ramp for Exit 2 in Auburn, NH.

Proceed 0.2 miles (passing Holiday's Bar and Grill)  and turn left onto Old Candia Road.

Proceed 0.4 miles and turn left onto Tower Hill Road ( 6 Tower Hill Road a Red House is right on the corner of the intersection of Tower Hill Road/Old Candia Road)

Just after going through the underpass for 101 highway park near the gate on the left which will be the trailhead.

On the first half of the hike we will start by doing a easy 3 mile loop hike around Tower Hill Pond.  Then those who feel up to it can continue on the second half of the hike as we pass the parked cars and  do an easy 3 mile loop hike around Clark Pond for a total of a 6 mile hike.

Unless just walking a distance of 3 miles or 6 miles is a problem for the shape you are in this would be considered an easy hike. Although there is some ascents and descents on the hike there are no really steep trail sections with any significant elevation gain or lose and most of the trail sections are old dirt roads that are relatively wide with mostly even ground. Even on the trail sections that are narrower the ground isn't that rough and is easy walking.

If you are doing the whole hike there will be a few active road crossings where you might want your dog on leash due to traffic if they don't do a heel well.
item.how_to_find_us: On NH 101 East turn right at the end of the ramp for Exit 2. Proceed 0.2 miles and turn left onto Old Candia Road. Proceed 0.4 miles and turn left at 6 Tower Hill Road (Red House) Just after underpass for 101 park near the gate on the left.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Tower Hill Pond - Clark Pond Hike- 3 Mile or 6 Mile Easy Hike
